intro: Astragalus mistassinicus, commonly known as the Mistassin milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to harsh, dry environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
